bio:
Xiaoyue Huang is an Language Lecturer at NYU Shanghai. She earns her master’s degree in Teaching Chinese as a Second Language from East China Normal University in 2015.

Huang previously worked as a Chinese teacher for the University of Virginia's Shanghai Summer Program in 2013. She also interned at the Singapore Center for Chinese Language for half a year as a research assistant. Huang also worked at EMLYON Business School in Shanghai and Donghua University as a Chinese teacher.

Research Interests

  • Chinese phonetics
  • Second language acquisition

Courses Taught

  • Elementary Chinese I
  • Elementary Chinese II

Education

  • MA, Teaching Chinese as a Second Language
    East China Normal University, 2015
  • BA, Chinese Language and Literature
    Hunan University, 2012
